book_overview.premise: Navigating foster life in rainy Seattle, nine-year-old Sasha Patel dives into 2025's 3D-printed sustainable fashion to express her style, but ADHD-tangled phonemes fray her ideas—until she weaves sounds into vibrant fabrics, threading frustration into fluent mastery that dazzles a eco-fashion show and bonds her foster family through shared phonemic creativity in a heartwarming weave of identity and invention.

name_age_background.name: Sasha Patel
name_age_background.background: Indian-American girl in foster care in Seattle, with a diverse foster family
name_age_background.struggle: ADHD impacting phonemic awareness and sound blending

personality_traits: Creative and passionate about their interest
Resilient when pursuing what they love
Kind-hearted but sometimes defensive about difficulties
protagonist_profile.passion: Sustainable 3D-printed fashion trends in 2025's eco-conscious youth culture
protagonist_profile.growth_arc: Sasha's ADHD scatters her sound awareness, frustrating design descriptions, she blends phonemes in prints for a breakthrough, masters it to win a fashion contest, and teaches foster siblings the fun way

mentor_guide.personality: Patient, encouraging, sees potential in protagonist
mentor_guide.function: Provides explicit instruction and connects passion to skill

peer_group.description: 3-4 diverse classmates with varying learning profiles
peer_group.function: Normalize struggles, provide collaboration opportunities, show different paths

parallel_adult.starting_belief: Worried about protagonist's struggles, potentially fixed mindset

secondary_setting.secondary: Holographic 3D design studio that vibrates with phoneme sounds

setting_description.sensory_details: Vivid descriptions of creative spaces, technology, peer interactions
setting_description.memorable_elements: Her fabrics 'sing' blended phonemes when worn, turning clothes into interactive lessons
